decks.notes: This deck focuses on quickly building up a creature with powerful auras to deal damage to the opponent swiftly. The key strategy is to enchant a creature with auras such as All That Glitters, Ethereal Armor, and Gryff's Boon to pump up its power and toughness, while also protecting it with cards like Alseid of Life's Bounty and Selfless Savior. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy, using a combination of auras and efficient creatures to take control of the game.

This deck focuses on quickly deploying cheap artifact creatures and enchanting them with powerful effects to overwhelm the opponent quickly. Using cards like Skilled Animator and Ensoul Artifact to turn cheap artifacts into powerful threats, the deck aims to deal damage quickly and efficiently. Cards like Ghostfire Blade and Shrapnel Blast provide additional ways to boost damage output or remove threats from the opponent. With a low mana curve and a focus on aggressive plays, this deck aims to win the game before the opponent can stabilize.

The main concept of this deck is to combo off by using cards like Balustrade Spy to mill your entire library, putting all of your Prized Amalgams into play and triggering their abilities. Creeping Chill and Silversmote Ghoul help you gain life and keep the combo going, while Eldritch Evolution and Sea Gate Restoration provide ways to find your combo pieces. This deck focuses on utilizing graveyard recursion and powerful land spells to overwhelm your opponent with a massive board presence in a landless strategy.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly and efficiently mill your own deck in order to put key graveyard cards into play, such as Prized Amalgam and Silversmote Ghoul. By using cards like Balustrade Spy and Undercity Informer, you can fill your graveyard with powerful creatures and then bring them back with recursion spells like Haunted Dead. The deck focuses on using the graveyard as a resource to generate advantage and overwhelm your opponent with a strong board presence.

This Golgari Aggro deck focuses on quickly flooding the board with low-cost creatures like Elvish Mystic and Llanowar Elves, while also utilizing sacrifice effects from cards like Priest of Forgotten Gods and Woe Strider to deal damage to the opponent. Zulaport Cutthroat and Mayhem Devil are key pieces in draining the opponent's life total. Collected Company and Bolas's Citadel provide card advantage and can lead to explosive turns. The deck also includes Agadeem's Awakening for potential recursion of key creatures. This deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of creature aggression and sacrifice synergy.

The deck focuses on controlling the game by disrupting the opponent's strategies through discard spells like Thoughtseize and Agonizing Remorse, counterspells like Disallow and Censor, and board wipes like Supreme Verdict. It also aims to generate card advantage and card selection with cards like Dig Through Time, Narset, Parter of Veils, and Teferi, Hero of Dominaria. The win condition of the deck comes from resolving powerful threats like Torrential Gearhulk and utilizing Teferi, Time Raveler to lock down the opponent's plays. The deck also utilizes lands that provide multiple colors of mana for flexibility in casting spells.

This deck focuses on controlling the game through various means such as removal spells, counterspells, and planeswalkers. It aims to outvalue the opponent by generating card advantage and disrupting their game plan while setting up its win conditions. The inclusion of Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion allows for additional value through blinking permanents and creating incremental advantage. The deck is designed to have answers for a variety of threats and to grind out victories through attrition and careful decision-making.

The main concept of this deck is to establish a fast and aggressive board presence using a combination of low-cost creatures with abilities that complement each other. By utilizing cards like Luminarch Aspirant and Thalia's Lieutenant to pump up the team and provide evasion, along with protection and removal options from cards like Brave the Elements and Dire Tactics, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent early in the game. The mana base is designed to provide consistent access to the deck's colors while minimizing potential life loss from lands.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly and aggressively deal damage to the opponent using low-cost spells and creatures. The deck focuses on using cards like Lightning Strike, Boros Charm, and Viashino Pyromancer to deal damage directly to the opponent while maintaining a board presence with creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Soul-Scar Mage. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion allows for additional value by allowing cards to be recast from the graveyard. Overall, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents with fast and efficient damage output.

The deck revolves around utilizing Fires of Invention to cast powerful spells for free, along with Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion for extra value. The goal is to control the game with cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Agent of Treachery, while also ramping with cards like Growth Spiral and Omnath, Locus of Creation. The deck also includes removal like Chained to the Rocks and Anger of the Gods to deal with threats. Overall, the strategy focuses on generating card advantage and overwhelming the opponent with powerful plays.

This deck focuses on using Lotus Field along with cards like Strategic Planning, Pore Over the Pages, and Dig Through Time to quickly assemble a powerful combo. By untapping Lotus Field with Hidden Strings and Vizier of Tumbling Sands, the deck aims to generate a large amount of mana to cast spells like Peer into the Abyss for a game-winning effect. The main strategy is to dig through the deck quickly, find key pieces of the combo, and overwhelm the opponent with a burst of mana and card advantage.

The deck focuses on controlling the game by using a mixture of counterspells, creature removal, card draw, and powerful planeswalkers. It aims to stall the game and generate card advantage until it can stabilize the board and take over with powerful threats like Uro and Shark Typhoon. The inclusion of Yorion as a companion allows for additional value and potentially overwhelming the opponent with a large board presence. The mana base is designed to support the triple-color requirements of the deck efficiently.

This deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and disruption spells. The focus is on quickly draining the opponent's life total through efficient beatdowns and targeted removal. By playing threats like Bloodsoaked Champion, Knight of the Ebon Legion, and Rankle, Master of Pranks, while also disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push, this deck aims to establish early dominance on the battlefield and maintain pressure until victory is achieved.

The deck focuses on using Niv-Mizzet Reborn to control the game by drawing cards and generating value from a wide variety of multicolored spells. It includes several powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Time Raveler and Nahiri, the Harbinger, along with versatile removal spells like Dreadbore and Abrupt Decay. The deck also features a toolbox approach with cards like Bring to Light to search for specific answers in different situations. By leveraging the diverse range of colors and powerful spells, the deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver the opponent to secure victory.

This control deck focuses on utilizing the full spectrum of colors available through Niv-Mizzet Reborn to efficiently control the game and outvalue opponents. With powerful cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath, as well as the tutor effect provided by Bring to Light, the deck aims to control the board while generating card advantage and threatening late-game dominance with powerful threats. The inclusion of Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion adds additional value and flexibility to the deck's game plan.

This Rakdos Aggro deck focuses on utilizing the graveyard as a resource with cards like Dreadhorde Arcanist and Kroxa. It aims to pressure the opponent with early aggression from cards like Young Pyromancer while disrupting their game plan with cards like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push. The deck also has options for card advantage and flexibility with Village Rites and Kolaghan's Command. Overall, the deck seeks to control the board and outvalue the opponent by leveraging its graveyard synergies and efficient removal spells.
